intro: Oreocharis jinpingensis, commonly known as the Jinping oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble a cup shape. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in mountainous regions with high elevation. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
